longDef.en: used before nouns to refer to particular things or people that have already been talked about or are already known or that are in a situation where it is clear what is happening
longDef.cn: （用于名词前，指听者或读者已知的事物或人，尤指已提到的或能被领会的事物或人）

examples.en: I just bought a new shirt and some new shoes. The shirt was pretty expensive, but the shoes weren't.
examples.cn: 我刚买了一件新衬衫和几双新鞋。衬衫很贵，但鞋子不贵。

examples.en: Please would you pass the salt.
examples.cn: 请你把盐递给我。

examples.en: I'll pick you up at the airport.
examples.cn: 我会开车到机场接你。

longDef.en: used before some nouns that refer to place when you want to mention that type of place, without showing exactly which example of the place you mean
longDef.cn: （用于某些名词前，表示泛指一类地方）

examples.en: We spent all day at the beach.
examples.cn: 我们在海滩上呆了一整天。

examples.en: Let's go to the movies this evening.
examples.cn: 我们今晚去看电影吧。

examples.en: I have to go to the bank and get some Euros.
examples.cn: 我得去银行兑换些欧元。

longDef.en: used before noun phrases in which the range of meaning of the noun is limited in some way
longDef.cn: （用在带有限制性定语的名词短语前）

examples.en: I really enjoyed the book I've just finished reading.
examples.cn: 我真的很喜欢我刚读完的那本书。

examples.en: Do you like the other kids in your class?
examples.cn: 你喜欢你们班的其他同学吗？

longDef.en: used to refer to things or people when only one exists at any one time

examples.en: What will happen in the future?
examples.cn: 未来会发生什么事？

examples.en: After I leave college, I want to travel around the world.
examples.cn: 大学毕业后，我想环游世界。

examples.en: They live in the north of Spain.
examples.cn: 他们住在西班牙北部。

examples.en: Ed Koch was for many years the mayor of New York.
examples.cn: 埃德‧科克做了多年的纽约市长。

examples.en: When we went to Paris, we went up the Eiffel Tower.
examples.cn: 我们到巴黎时去了埃菲尔铁塔。

longDef.en: used before superlatives and other words, such as "first" or "only" or numbers showing something's position in a list, to refer to only one thing or person
longDef.cn: （用于形容词或副词最高级及表示排名的词前）

examples.en: That was one of the best films I've ever seen.
examples.cn: 那是我看过的最好的电影之一。

examples.en: What's the highest mountain in Asia?
examples.cn: 亚洲最高的山是哪一座？

examples.en: I will never forget the first time we met.
examples.cn: 我永远也忘不了我们第一次见面的情形。

examples.en: You're the fifth person to ask me that question.
examples.cn: 你是第5个问我那个问题的人。

longDef.en: used to say that the particular person or thing being mentioned is the best, most famous, etc. In this use, "the" is usually given strong pronunciation
longDef.cn: （用于表示“最…的”，此时 the 应重读）

examples.en: Harry's Bar is the place to go.
examples.cn: 哈里酒吧是最值得一去的。

examples.en: You don't mean you met the Will Smith (= the film star), do you?
examples.cn: 你不是说你见到了威尔‧史密斯本人吧？

longDef.en: used before some adjectives to turn the adjectives into nouns that refer to one particular person or thing described by the adjective
longDef.cn: （用在形容词前，指特定的人或事物）

examples.en: It seems that the deceased (= this particular dead person) had no living relatives.
examples.cn: 看来死者没有健在的亲属。

examples.en: I suppose we'll just have to wait for the inevitable (= the particular thing that is certain to happen).
examples.cn: 看来我们只好坐等那不可避免的事情发生。

longDef.en: used before some adjectives to turn the adjectives into nouns that refer to people or things in general that can be described by the adjective
longDef.cn: （用在形容词前构成名词，泛指一类人或事物）

examples.en: She lives in a special home for the elderly.
examples.cn: 她住在养老院。

examples.en: The French were defeated at Waterloo in 1815.
examples.cn: 1815年法军在滑铁卢被击败。

longDef.en: used before a singular noun to refer to all the things or people represented by that noun
longDef.cn: （用在单数名词前，指该类事物或人）

examples.en: The panda is becoming an increasingly rare animal.
examples.cn: 熊猫这种动物数量越来越稀少了。

examples.en: The car is responsible for causing a lot of damage to our environment.
examples.cn: 汽车对我们的环境造成了严重破坏。

longDef.en: used before a family name to refer to two people who are married or to a whole family
longDef.cn: （用在姓氏前表示某夫妇或一家人）

examples.en: The Jacksons are coming to visit on Saturday.
examples.cn: 杰克逊一家周六要来看我们。

longDef.en: used before some nouns referring to musical instruments or dances to mean the type of instrument or dance in general
longDef.cn: （用在乐器或舞蹈的名称前表泛指）

examples.en: Nico is learning to play the piano.
examples.cn: 尼科在学弹钢琴。

examples.en: Can you do the waltz?
examples.cn: 你会跳华尔兹吗？

longDef.en: used before a noun to represent the activity connected with that noun
longDef.cn: （用在名词前表示与名词有关的活动）

examples.en: I'm going under the knife (= having a medical operation) next week.
examples.cn: 我下周要接受外科手术。

examples.en: It's not a good idea to spend more than three hours at the wheel (= driving a vehicle) without a break.
examples.cn: 连续驾车3个多小时不是个好主意。

longDef.en: used before numbers that refer to periods of ten years

examples.en: the 60s
examples.cn: 60年代

longDef.en: used before each of two comparative adjectives or adverbs when you want to show how one amount gets bigger or smaller in relation to the other
longDef.cn: （用在两个形容词或副词比较级前，表示“越…越…”）

examples.en: The sooner I get this piece of work done, the sooner I can go home.
examples.cn: 我越快完成这项工作，就能越早回家。

longDef.en: used before comparative adjectives or adverbs when you want to show that someone or something has become more or less of a particular state
longDef.cn: （用在形容词或副词比较级前，表示某人或事物的特定状态的变化）

examples.en: She doesn't seem to be any the worse for her bad experience.
examples.cn: 她看来丝毫没有因为悲惨的经历而沮丧。

longDef.en: used for emphasis when you are expressing a strong opinion about someone or something

examples.en: André's got a new job, the lucky devil.
examples.cn: 安德烈有了新工作，这个幸运的家伙。

longDef.en: used instead of a possessive adjective such as your, her, or my

examples.en: He held his daughter by the arm (= her arm).
examples.cn: 他抓着女儿的胳膊。

examples.en: I can't remember where I parked the (= my) car.
examples.cn: 我不记得把车停在哪儿了。

examples.en: I'd like to go out tonight, but I don't think I have the energy.
examples.cn: 我倒是想今晚出去玩，但又觉得自己没那个精力。

examples.en: I don't have the time to talk to you now.
examples.cn: 我现在没有时间和你谈话。

examples.en: It does 30 miles to the gallon.
examples.cn: 这辆车每加仑汽油能跑30英里。
